# LINQ to SQL

> Documentation for LINQ to SQL.

*Topics available: 157*

For clients to be able to update/delete data, you must attach the entities to a new data context.

Refer to these examples to use DataContext to connect to a database and to get rows.

LINQ to SQL translates deletions to SQL DELETE commands.

LINQ to SQL translates additions to SQL INSERT commands.

Use such a table-valued function just like a table.

- [LINQ to SQL](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/data/adonet/sql/linq/index.md): LINQ to SQL is a component of the .NET Framework that provides a runtime infrastructure for managing relational data as objects.
